channel.title: CVE Feed for reputeinfosystems -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for reputeinfosystems -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-42888|2024-08-03T13:19:05.202Z -- reputeinfosystems -- armember
item.description: Unauth. Privilege Escalation vulnerability in ARMember premium plugin <= 5.5.1 on WordPress.

item.title: CVE-2024-6660|2024-08-01T21:41:04.263Z -- reputeinfosystems -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20bookingpress
item.description: The BookingPress – Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data that can lead to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the bookingpress_import_data_continue_process_func function in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to update arbitrary options on the WordPress site and upload arbitrary files. This can be leveraged to update the default role for registration to administrator and enable user registration for attackers to gain administrative user access to a vulnerable site.

item.title: CVE-2024-6467|2024-08-01T21:41:03.419Z -- reputeinfosystems -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20bookingpress
item.description: The BookingPress – Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Read to Arbitrary File Creation in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5 via the 'bookingpress_save_lite_wizard_settings_func' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to create arbitrary files that contain the content of files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files or the exposure of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-3022|2024-08-01T19:32:42.511Z -- reputeinfosystems -- bookingpress%20%E2%80%93%20appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin
item.description: The BookingPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to insufficient filename validation in the 'bookingpress_process_upload' function in all versions up to, and including 1.0.87. This allows an authenticated attacker with administrator-level capabilities or higher to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server, enabling remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-6467|2024-07-23T14:44:53.298Z -- reputeinfosystems -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20bookingpress
item.description: The BookingPress – Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Read to Arbitrary File Creation in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5 via the 'bookingpress_save_lite_wizard_settings_func' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to create arbitrary files that contain the content of files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files or the exposure of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-6660|2024-07-17T06:45:09.895Z -- reputeinfosystems -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20bookingpress
item.description: The BookingPress – Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data that can lead to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the bookingpress_import_data_continue_process_func function in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to update arbitrary options on the WordPress site and upload arbitrary files. This can be leveraged to update the default role for registration to administrator and enable user registration for attackers to gain administrative user access to a vulnerable site.

item.title: CVE-2024-6467|2024-07-17T06:45:11.571Z -- reputeinfosystems -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20bookingpress
item.description: The BookingPress – Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Read to Arbitrary File Creation in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5 via the 'bookingpress_save_lite_wizard_settings_func' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to create arbitrary files that contain the content of files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files or the exposure of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-3022|2024-06-20T15:17:18.951Z -- reputeinfosystems -- bookingpress%20%E2%80%93%20appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin
item.description: The BookingPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to insufficient filename validation in the 'bookingpress_process_upload' function in all versions up to, and including 1.0.87. This allows an authenticated attacker with administrator-level capabilities or higher to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server, enabling remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-3022|2024-04-04T01:56:44.555Z -- reputeinfosystems -- bookingpress%20%E2%80%93%20appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin
item.description: The BookingPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to insufficient filename validation in the 'bookingpress_process_upload' function in all versions up to, and including 1.0.87. This allows an authenticated attacker with administrator-level capabilities or higher to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server, enabling remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-32703|2024-06-09T17:17:52.524Z -- reputeinfosystems -- arforms
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in reputeinfosystems ARForms.This issue affects ARForms: from n/a through 6.4.

item.title: CVE-2024-32705|2024-06-11T00:52:07.239Z -- reputeinfosystems -- arforms
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in reputeinfosystems ARForms.This issue affects ARForms: from n/a through 6.4.

item.title: CVE-2024-32704|2024-06-10T14:50:56.498Z -- reputeinfosystems -- arforms
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in reputeinfosystems ARForms.This issue affects ARForms: from n/a through 6.4.

item.title: CVE-2024-4133|2024-05-02T16:52:17.860Z -- reputeinfosystems -- armember%20%E2%80%93%20membership%20plugin%2C%20content%20restriction%2C%20member%20levels%2C%20user%20profile%20%26%20user%20signup
item.description: The ARMember – Membership Plugin, Content Restriction, Member Levels, User Profile & User signup plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Open Redirect in all versions up to, and including, 4.0.30. This is due to insufficient validation on the redirect url supplied via the redirect_to parameter. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to redirect users to potentially malicious sites if they can successfully trick them into performing an action.

item.title: CVE-2024-0969|2024-02-05T21:22:05.137Z -- reputeinfosystems -- armember%20%E2%80%93%20membership%20plugin%2C%20content%20restriction%2C%20member%20levels%2C%20user%20profile%20%26%20user%20signup
item.description: The ARMember plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.21 via the REST API. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to bypass the plugin's "Default Restriction" feature and view restricted post content.

item.title: CVE-2024-1945|2024-06-04T18:00:03.859Z -- reputeinfosystems -- contact%20form%2C%20survey%20%26%20popup%20form%20plugin%20for%20wordpress%20%E2%80%93%20%20arforms%20form%20builder
item.description: The Contact Form, Survey & Popup Form Plugin for WordPress – ARForms Form Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized loss of data due to a missing capability check on the 'arflite_remove_preview_data' function in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber access and above, to delete arbitrary site options, resulting in loss of availability.

item.title: CVE-2024-4133|2024-07-15T16:34:15.093Z -- reputeinfosystems -- armember%20%E2%80%93%20membership%20plugin%2C%20content%20restriction%2C%20member%20levels%2C%20user%20profile%20%26%20user%20signup
item.description: The ARMember – Membership Plugin, Content Restriction, Member Levels, User Profile & User signup plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Open Redirect in all versions up to, and including, 4.0.30. This is due to insufficient validation on the redirect url supplied via the redirect_to parameter. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to redirect users to potentially malicious sites if they can successfully trick them into performing an action.
